title: Sri Lanka stocks slips over 1.5-pct in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s stocks slipped over 1.5 percent within the first hour of trade on Wednesday (15) on weak sentiments due to the on-going economic crisis in the country, dealer said.
The main All Share Price Index slipped 1.45 percent or 114.39 points to 7,774.30 at 1135 hrs.
“At this point, there is no catalyst for the market to go up while there’s selling pressure due to margin calls hence the dip in the market,” a top market analyst said.
The most liquid index S&P SL20 lost 1.91 percent or 48.51 points to 2,497.24.
